directions: Melt butter in heavy large saucepan over medium heat. Add potatoes and onions. Stir until coated with butter, about 1 minute. Sprinkle flour over; stir 1 minute. Add 2 3/4 cups broth and milk. Cover pan. Boil gently until potatoes and onions are tender, about 10 minutes.
Puree soup in batches in blender. Return to pan. Add 1 3/4 cups watercress. Bring back to simmer. Season with salt and pepper. Thin with more broth, if desired.
Lade soup into bowls. Garnish with remaining 1/2 cup watercress.
ingredients: 2 large russet potatoes, peeled, cut into 1/2-inch pieces
1 3/4 cups milk (do not use low-fat or nonfat)
title: Cream of Potato Soup with Watercress
